arch:property.oc:show_val: mudbrick wall at south end of trench composed of variably soft, moist mudbrick soil with lots of clay inclusions and harder reddish classic mudbrick soil. Located between 5m section cut and south edge of wall component 2132 and south of reed mat 2130. Practically no sherds came out of the first 1m x 0.25m representative sample area. Mixed bricks with random placement (ie, not set squarely in line with each other, sometimes skewed and sometimes not well formed/outlined). Looking at south and east and west sections, it is very very clear that 2131 is composed of bands of alternating colored brick courses. Alternating brick color: a) 5Y 7/3 pale yellow b) 2.5Y 6/3 light yellowish brown c) 10YR 5/3 brown d) 7.5YR 4/3 brown e) 7.5YR 6/1 gray (when wet!!) f) 7.5YR 4/6 strong brown (bricks with lots of clay inclusions) NB--metal ore stones found occasionally in 2131 but not collected because at the time I didn"t know that these stones are special. Note that we ran a c-14 sample from this locus (KT #15) and it came back with a 2- sigma callabrated date of 2880-2580 B.C. We think that this is the date of the top of the massive wall (once the wall had fallen out of use) rather than the data of the wall itself because we have 3 earlier dates that came from in this wall and in the wall in A8.
continuation of wall at lower elevations of 2114
loose, dark soil mixed with harder patches of obvious mudbricks
white plaster line runs vertically east-west through L2131and continues into 2140

arch:note.arch:string: Contexts excavated in trenches were recorded using the "locus system." A locus is any discrete three-dimensional entity excavated in a trench. The key to the locus system is the recognition that a locus is any one thing. Differences in soil composition or texture are therefore as important as, for example, the difference between a pit and a wall. If two entities were distinct, they were considered separate loci and were therefore assigned separate locus numbers. It should also be noted that every context excavated in a trench was given a locus number and thus the trench itself is made up completely of excavated loci.

arch:property.oc:show_val: L2116, 2124, 2128 (these three constitute mudbrick fill with ash lens), 2133 (beaten earth surface), 2134 (ash surface or ash lying on a surface where the surface would be 2135).
mudbrick wall with alternating brick color
north half founded on 2139 cobblestone footing; south half TBA
2132, 2126, 2139 (all part of the same wall system)
Part of an enormous retaining wall, terrace support or defensive structure. NB also: reed mat impressions of 2141 associated with 2139, 2140, 2130 (=reed mat in east half of trench).
